Song.title: May the Lord Be Your Delight
Song.copyright: Words and Music by Jon Bloom. © 1996 Jon Bloom.

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: May the Lord be your delight May he be the brightest light That your heart-eyes ever see For seeing him will set you free From seeking joy in dying things And satisfy your soul’s longings Child I pray the Lord will be The brightest light you ever see
Verse 2: May your gracious Father show Mercy on you as you grow And incline your youthful heart To love him from the very start And to believe his promises Are true despite what Satan says Child I pray the Lord will show Great mercy on you as you grow
Verse 3: May he make you strong and bold So that when you’re very old You’ll recall how God kept you From loving sin and saw you through Some painful trials and let you see Some mighty kingdom victories Child I pray as you grow old The Lord will make you strong and bold.
Verse 4: May the Lord be your delight May your heart-eyes see the light Shining bright in Jesus’ face His deep, deep love, his lavish grace For on the cross he died to pay For all your sins and make a way So, child, he can eternally Give joy to you and set you free.
